Name: Nitrogen (N)
Use: Promotes leafy growth and improves yield.

Name: Phosphorus (P)
Use: Strengthens roots and helps in flowering.

Name: Potassium (K)
Use: Improves disease resistance and fruit quality.

Name: Urea
Use: High source of nitrogen for fast growth.

Name: DAP (Di-Ammonium Phosphate)
Use: Good source of phosphorus and nitrogen.

Name: MOP (Muriate of Potash)
Use: Provides potassium for crop strength.

Name: Drip irrigation
Use: Saves water and increases productivity.

Name: Sprinkler irrigation
Use: Uniform water distribution, suitable for light soils.

Name: Canal irrigation
Use: Provides water for large fields using canal systems.

Name: Rain-fed farming
Use: Depends on natural rainfall, common in dry regions.

Name: Rice
Use: Grows well in clayey soil; requires high water and warm climate (20–25°C, 150 cm rainfall).

Name: Wheat
Use: Prefers loamy soil and cooler climates (10–15°C).

Name: Tomato
Use: Needs well-drained soil, moderate watering, and sunlight.

Name: Maize
Use: Thrives in well-drained fertile soil; requires moderate rainfall.

Name: Pulses
Use: Improve soil fertility through nitrogen fixation.

Name: Neem oil
Use: Effective against aphids and caterpillars.

Name: Garlic spray
Use: Repels aphids and beetles naturally.

Name: Chili extract
Use: Controls whiteflies and caterpillars.

Name: Marigold intercropping
Use: Repels nematodes and pests in tomato fields.

Name: Crop rotation
Use: Improves soil health and prevents pest buildup.

Name: Intercropping
Use: Growing two crops together for better resource use and pest control.

Name: Mulching
Use: Conserves soil moisture and controls weeds.
